channel.title: Trying to add MP3. I compiled, this is my result
channel.description: [code]EGUI.java:18: class Gui is public, should be declared in a file named Gui.java public class Gui extends client ^ EGUI.java:18: cannot inherit from final client public class Gui extends client ^ EGUI.java:19: cannot find symbol symbol: class ItemListener implements ActionListener, ItemListener, WindowListener ^ EGUI.java:19: cannot find symbol symbol: class WindowListener implements ActionListener, ItemListener, WindowListener ^ EGUI.java:21: cannot find symbol symbol : class FileOutputStream location: class Gui private static FileOutputStream logFileOut; ^ EGUI.java:25: cannot find symbol symbol : class sequencer location: class Gui public sequencer sequencer; ^ MP3Player.java:45: cannot find symbol symbol : method log(java.lang.String) location: class Gui Gui.log("MP3 player error!"); ^ Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 7 errors Finished! Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

item.title: Trying to add MP3. I compiled, this is my result
item.dc:creator: @crimsonbow13 crimsonbow13
item.description:
@crimsonbow13 wrote:

I dont know how to fix that error…
This is my EGUI, its small:

[code]import java.awt.BorderLayout;
import java.awt.Cursor;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import javax.swing.*;

public class EGUI {
public static void main(String args[]) {
client.main(
new String[] {
“disciplescape.no-ip.biz”, “disciplescape.no-ip.biz”,
“disciplescape.no-ip.biz”
});
}
}
[/code]

item.title: Trying to add MP3. I compiled, this is my result
item.dc:creator: @relmitos relmitos
item.description:
@relmitos wrote:

No just the EGUI class.

And to fix this error:

MP3Player.java:45: cannot find symbol
symbol  : method log(java.lang.String)
location: class EGUI
            EGUI.log("MP3 player error!");

Declare this in the EGUI class:

public void log(String string1){
    System.out.println(string1);
)

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @crimsonbow13 crimsonbow13
item.description:
@crimsonbow13 wrote:

I changed the names, and this time not 7, but 8 errors:

Gui.java:8: class EGUI is public, should be declared in a file named EGUI.java public class EGUI { ^ Gui.java:18: cannot inherit from final client public class Gui extends client ^ Gui.java:19: cannot find symbol symbol: class ItemListener implements ActionListener, ItemListener, WindowListener ^ Gui.java:19: cannot find symbol symbol: class WindowListener implements ActionListener, ItemListener, WindowListener ^ Gui.java:21: cannot find symbol symbol : class FileOutputStream location: class Gui private static FileOutputStream logFileOut; ^ Gui.java:25: cannot find symbol symbol : class sequencer location: class Gui public sequencer sequencer; ^ Gui.java:18: Gui is not abstract and does not override abstract method actionPer formed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent) in java.awt.event.ActionListener public class Gui extends client ^ MP3Player.java:45: cannot find symbol symbol : method log(java.lang.String) location: class Gui Gui.log("MP3 player error!"); ^ Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 8 errors Finished! Press any key to continue . . .[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 11, 2010, 01:32:53 pm[/size][hr]My original file I run ‘is’ EGUI… So I just tried changing to Gui.
